Enumeration Type Documentation

◆ ALGO_STATE_e

enum ALGO_STATE_e

states that an algorithm can take

Enumerator
ALGO_UNINITIALIZED 

This is the default value indicating that initialization has not run yet

ALGO_READY 

This indicates that the algorithm is ready to be run on next time slot

ALGO_RUNNING 

This indicates that the algorithm is currently running. Note that it may not spend more than ALGO_TASKS_s::maxCalculationDuration_ms in this state.

ALGO_BLOCKED 

This indicates that the algorithm has violated its maximum calculation duration.

ALGO_FAILED_INIT 

This indicates a failed initialization.

ALGO_REINIT_REQUESTED 

This indicates that a reinitialization of the algorithm has been requested.

Definition at line 83 of file algorithm_cfg.h.
